meanings.definition: The sweet and fleshy product of a tree or other plant that contains seeds and can be eaten as food.
meanings.sent1: I love eating fresh fruits every morning for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She bought a variety of fruits from the market for the fruit salad.
meanings.sent3: The monkey happily munched on the ripe fruits hanging from the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a burst of colorful fruits in a dull room.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the ripe fruits filled the kitchen with a delightful aroma.

meanings.definition: The result or reward of work or activity.
meanings.sent1: His hard work finally bore fruits when he received a promotion.
meanings.sent2: The successful completion of the project was the fruits of their labor.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected bonus at work was a sweet fruit of his dedication.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness towards others always yields the sweetest fruits of friendship.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's dedication and training bore fruits in the form of a gold medal.

meanings.definition: To bear fruit, to produce a result or reward.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree fruits abundantly every autumn.
meanings.sent2: After years of hard work, his efforts finally fruited into success.
meanings.sent3: The long hours of practice fruited into a flawless performance on stage.
meanings.sent4: Her patience and perseverance fruited into a successful business venture.
meanings.sent5: The investment in education will fruit into a bright future.
